pageContext.claim: “You had cases where a farm would have a little puddle someplace -- a puddle -- when I grew up we used to call it a puddle, you too probably, and they (the federal government) considered it a lake. If you touched it, bad things happened to you and your family. We have given the farmers back their farms.”
pageContext.analysis: The Obama-era Waters of the United States rule technically has an exemption for puddles. But opponents of the rule argue say since a “puddle” is not defined in the rule, the EPA can still regulate what some people may consider puddles.
